On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d10} fire damage, is {@condition deafened} until the end of your next turn, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 20 feet away from the center of the area. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}, pushed, or {@condition deafened}.
Unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 20 feet away from the center of the area by the spell's effect.
This spell ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sonic Boom}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d10} and the distance a creature is pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Belching Aperture
entries: You conjure a belching portal to a minor plane of acid which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The portal sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, which is sunlight. The portal is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the portal to release acid in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

entries.name: Area Blast
entries: Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the portal, a 40-foot cone blasting from the portal, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the portal. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Constructs and earth elementals have disadvantage on this roll.

entries.name: Single Target
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the portal that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the portal's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} acid damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against undead and oozes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sun Flower|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Ghostfire Dragon
entries: You conjure a huge spectral dragon head which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The dragon head sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, which is sunlight. The dragon head is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the dragon head to release blazing blue flames in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

entries.name: Area Blast
entries: Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the dragon head, a 40-foot cone blasting from the dragon head, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the dragon head. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Creatures that are ablaze have disadvantage on this roll.

entries.name: Single Target
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the dragon head that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the dragon head's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against creatures that are ablaze.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sun Flower}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Storm Conduit
entries: You conjure a huge spinning coil of sparking blue lightning which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The coil sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, which is sunlight. The coil is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the coil to release blue lightning in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

entries.name: Area Blast
entries: Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the coil, a 40-foot cone blasting from the coil, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the coil. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Creatures wearing metal have disadvantage on this roll.

entries.name: Single Target
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the coil that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the coil's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against creatures wearing metal.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sun Flower}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Thunder Bell
entries: You conjure a huge spectral sunbell which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The bell sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, which is sunlight. The bell is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the bell to release blazing sunlight in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

entries.name: Area Blast
entries: Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the bell, a 40-foot cone blasting from the bell, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the bell. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Creatures made of inorganic materials, such as stone, crystal or metal, have disadvantage on this roll.

entries.name: Single Target
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the bell that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the bell's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} thunder damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against creatures made of inorganic material, such as  stone, crystal, or metal.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sun Flower}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Winter Spirit
entries: You conjure a spectral spirit of winter which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The spirit sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, which is sunlight. The spirit is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the spirit to exhale frosty mist. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

entries.name: Area Blast
entries: Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the spirit, a 40-foot cone blasting from the spirit, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the spirit. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. water elementals and plants have disadvantage on this roll.

entries.name: Single Target
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the spirit that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the spirit's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} cold damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against water elementals and plants.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sun Flower}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Water to Steam

components.m: a vial of acid and a lump of coal

entries: Choose a point you can see within range inside a body of water. The portions of that body of water that fit inside a 50-foot cube centered on that point become hot steam until the spell ends. Any creature that ends its turn within the area takes {@damage 7d4} fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried also take damage at the end of each of your turns.

While the spell lasts, your magic keeps the steam in the area from mingling with the surrounding water. When the spell ends, the steam returns to its original form as water. This does not alter the composition of the water.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Water to Acid}}

spell.name: Blazing Eagle
entries: You hurl fire in the shape of an eagle at one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6 + 15} fire damage and the spell ends. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

On a miss, the eagle flies past the target and begins flying through the air on its own, seeking out another target. Note the location of your target when you cast the spell. At the start of your next turn, you must repeat the spell attack (no action) against the creature within range that is now closest to that space, possibly even attacking yourself. If this attack misses or has no target, repeat this process using the location of the last target when the spell attacked it, repeating the attack each round until the spell ends.

The eagle uses {@sense blindsight} to find its targets, not vision, and it weaves around obstacles to reach its target, so subsequent attacks after the first ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and do not suffer disadvantage if you cannot see the target. If multiple creatures are tied for being the closest to the eagle when you repeat the attack, you choose which one the eagle attacks.
The eagle damages objects in its path that aren't being worn or carried. When this spell destroys an object or kills a creature, it is sliced in twain.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Annihilation Disk|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ravenous Acid Wyrm
entries: You hurl acid in the shape of a dragon at one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6 + 15} acid damage and the spell ends. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

On a miss, the dragon flies past the target and begins flying through the air on its own, seeking out another target. Note the location of your target when you cast the spell. At the start of your next turn, you must repeat the spell attack (no action) against the creature within range that is now closest to that space, possibly even attacking yourself. If this attack misses or has no target, repeat this process using the location of the last target when the spell attacked it, repeating the attack each round until the spell ends.

The dragon uses blindsight to find its targets, not vision, and it weaves around obstacles to reach its target, so subsequent attacks after the first ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and do not suffer disadvantage if you cannot see the target. If multiple creatures are tied for being the closest to the dragon when you repeat the attack, you choose which one the dragon attacks.
The dragon damages objects in its path that aren't being worn or carried. When this spell destroys an object or kills a creature, it is sliced in twain.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Annihilation Disk|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Storm Serpent
entries: You hurl lightning in the shape of a flying snake at one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6 + 15} lightning damage and the spell ends. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

On a miss, the serpent flies past the target and begins flying through the air on its own, seeking out another target. Note the location of your target when you cast the spell. At the start of your next turn, you must repeat the spell attack (no action) against the creature within range that is now closest to that space, possibly even attacking yourself. If this attack misses or has no target, repeat this process using the location of the last target when the spell attacked it, repeating the attack each round until the spell ends.

The serpent uses blindsight to find its targets, not vision, and it weaves around obstacles to reach its target, so subsequent attacks after the first ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and do not suffer disadvantage if you cannot see the target. If multiple creatures are tied for being the closest to the serpent when you repeat the attack, you choose which one the serpent attacks.
The serpent damages objects in its path that aren't being worn or carried. When this spell destroys an object or kills a creature, it is sliced in twain.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Annihilation Disk|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Infernal Column
entries: You create a horizontal pillar of whirling flame, the fire is made solid by interplanar magic. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d10} fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
This spell ignites any object in the area that isn't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Blade Barrier}}

spell.name: Flame Helix

components.m: a bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; and three silver pins

entries: You create branching helix coils of burning flame toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three coils then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the coils.
A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 10d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This spell ignites flammable objects that are targeted.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Chain Lightning}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional coil leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Refraction Beam

components.m: a bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; and three silver pins

entries: You create a beam of white light that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three colorful beams then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the beams.
A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 9d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The space of each target is filled with dim light.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Chain Lightning}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional beam leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Astral Reckoning

m.text: the powder of a crushed black pearl worth at least 500 gp

entries: Creatures in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within range are subjected to the astral light of the space between outer planes. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Circle of Death}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|6-9|2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Excoriate

components.m: a lodestone and a pinch of dust

entries: A thin blue ray made of electricity springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by {@spell wall of force}.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} lightning damage. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a {@spell true resurrection} or a {@spell wish} spell.

This spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Disintegrate}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d6 + 40|6-9|3d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Incinerate

components.m: a lodestone and a pinch of dust

entries: A thin orange ray of flame springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by {@spell wall of force}.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} fire damage. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a {@spell true resurrection} or a {@spell wish} spell.

This spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Disintegrate}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d6 + 40|6-9|3d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Liquefy

components.m: a lodestone and a pinch of dust

entries: A thin yellow ray of potent acid springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by {@spell wall of force}.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} acid damage. The target is liquefied if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.

A liquefied creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to green slime. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a {@spell true resurrection} or a {@spell wish} spell.

This spell automatically liquefies a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell liquefies a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Disintegrate}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d6 + 40|6-9|3d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Beluud's Vibration Bomb
entries: A globe of amber sound energy streaks from your fingertips to a point of your choice within range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d6} thunder damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
This spell deals half damage to any nonmagical objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the spell, if you wish. A small globe about the size of a sling stone, vibrating and humming softly, appears in your hand. At any time, you or a creature you give the globe to can throw the globe (to a range of 40 feet) or hurl it with a sling (to the sling's normal range). It shatters on impact, with the same effect as the normal casting of the spell. You can also set the globe down without shattering it. After 1 minute, if the globe hasn't already shattered, it explodes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Otiluke's Freezing Sphere}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d6|6-9|1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Seelie Step
entries: You step through the feywild, teleporting yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range.
Immediately after you appear, sparkling fairy dust courses out of the portal you stepped through.

Each other creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and {@damage 3d8} radiant damage, it is {@condition poisoned} and {@condition charmed} by the caster until the start of your next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition charmed} or {@condition poisoned}.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. That creature doesn't roll the saving throw. It must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Star Step}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radiant damage done increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Tempest Step
entries: You teleport in a flash of rumbling lightning, teleporting yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range.

Each other creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and {@damage 3d8} thunder damage, it is {@condition deafened}, pushed 20 feet away and can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and suffers none of those effects.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. That creature doesn't roll the saving throw. It must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell, and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Star Step}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the thunder damage done increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Encroaching Blizzard
entries: You summon a column of freezing cold rain, mist, and air in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends. The area is lightly obscured.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, icy winds pulse, and each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage, or {@damage 6d8} cold damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Solar Approach
entries: You summon a column light in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends. The area is filled with bright light, which is sunlight.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, the light pulses, and each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} radiant damage, or {@damage 6d6} radiant damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Spreading Cinders
entries: You summon a column of ashes and flames in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends. The area is lightly obscured.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, flames pulse, and each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage, or {@damage 6d8} fire damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
This spell ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Sprouting Petal Swarm
entries: You summon a whirl of wind and forest dust, with razor-sharp leaves, grass and petals flying about in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends. The area is lightly obscured.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, the plants whirl, and each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} slashing damage, or {@damage 6d6} slashing damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
The caster can choose to make plants and beasts in the area unaffected.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Surging Acid Storm
entries: You summon a column of acidic rain, mist, and air in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends. The area is lightly obscured.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, the area pulses with swells of caustic wind, and each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage, or {@damage 6d6} acid damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Thunderous Chords
entries: You summon a column of sound, heard as a rumbling, thumping bass in a 60-foot-tall cylinder with a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range that lasts until the spell ends.

Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can use an action to strengthen the spell with your magic. If you do, the radius of the area grows by 10 feet for the duration. This cannot extend the radius beyond 60 feet.

At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, lightning pulses, and each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} thunder damage, or {@damage 6d6} thunder damage if you cast the spell this turn or you used your action to strengthen it this turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
Creatures in the area are {@condition deafened}.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Swelling Storm}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the max radius for the area increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Twinkle Toes

components.m: a matchstick or a piece of flint

entries: Your legs glow brightly and begin to move at blinding speed. When the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, you gain 60 extra feet of movement for that turn only. In addition, you gain the following benefits for the duration:

items: You shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
You do not provoke opportunity attacks by moving.
You can move through other creatures' spaces, and you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling, but only on your turns.

When you move into a creature's space for the first time on one of your turns, that creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 6d4} radiant damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If you end your turn in an occupied space, you fall {@condition prone} in the nearest unoccupied space.

When you move across the ground on your turn, you leave an area of light in your wake that lasts until the end of your next turn. The path of light is as wide as your space and reaches 5 feet high. When another creature ends its turn within the light, it takes {@damage 4d4} radiant damage.

entries: {@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Trailblazer}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt on your turns increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Waveglider

components.m: a matchstick or a piece of flint

entries: You stake along a wave of green acid that leaves puddles of sticky, evaporating acid in its wake. When the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, you gain 60 extra feet of movement for that turn only. In addition, you gain the following benefits for the duration:

items: You do not provoke opportunity attacks by moving.
When you move, terrain you traverse becomes difficult terrain for creatures on the ground for the duration.
You can move through other creatures' spaces, and you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling, but only on your turns.

When you move into a creature's space for the first time on one of your turns, that creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 6d4} acid damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If you end your turn in an occupied space, you fall {@condition prone} in the nearest unoccupied space.

When you move across the ground on your turn, you leave an area of acid in your wake that lasts until the end of your next turn. The path of acid is as wide as your space and reaches 5 feet high. When another creature ends its turn within the acid, it takes {@damage 4d4} acid damage.

entries: {@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Trailblazer}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt on your turns increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Windrunner

components.m: a matchstick or a piece of flint

entries: You are propelled by howling wind. When the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, you gain 60 extra feet of movement for that turn only. In addition, you gain the following benefits for the duration:

items: You do not provoke opportunity attacks by moving.
You disperse gas and vapor and extinguish candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area.
You can move through other creatures' spaces, and you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling, but only on your turns.

When you move into a creature's space for the first time on one of your turns, that creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 6d4} thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If you end your turn in an occupied space, you fall {@condition prone} in the nearest unoccupied space.

When you move on your turn, you leave an area of wind in your wake that lasts until the end of your next turn. The path of wind is as wide as your space and reaches 5 feet high. When another creature ends its turn within the wind, it takes {@damage 4d4} thunder damage.

entries: {@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Trailblazer}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt on your turns increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Frozen Flame Orb

components.m: two animal stomachs, one inside the other

entries: You blast one creature or object that you can see within range with an orb of freezing ice filled with scorching flame that crashes over the target, bursting and spraying beyond it. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d4} cold damage.

In addition, hit or miss, the blast sprays around the target, creating a 60-foot cone of flame originating from the space just in front of the target. The cone is facing away from you and must include the target in its area. Each creature in the area (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} fire damage, or half as much damage on a success.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Beluud's Bile Blossom}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the  damage dealt (for both parts) increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Light to Shadow

components.m: two animal stomachs, one inside the other

entries: You blast one creature or object that you can see within range with a beam of bright golden light that crashes over the target, bursting and spraying beyond it. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d4} radiant damage.

In addition, hit or miss, the blast sprays around the target, creating a 60-foot cone of chocking magical darkness originating from the space just in front of the target. The cone is facing away from you and must include the target in its area. Each creature in the area (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Beluud's Bile Blossom}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage dealt (for both parts) increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Rizzak's Blazing Lightning

components.m: two animal stomachs, one inside the other

entries: You blast one creature or object that you can see within range with a bolt of lightning that crashes over the target, bursting and spraying beyond it in flames. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d4} lightning damage.

In addition, hit or miss, the blast sprays around the target, creating a 60-foot cone of flame originating from the space just in front of the target. The cone is facing away from you and must include the target in its area. Each creature in the area (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} fire damage, or half as much damage on a success.
This spell ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Beluud's Bile Blossom}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the  damage dealt (for both parts) increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Thundercrash Cannon

components.m: two animal stomachs, one inside the other

entries: You blast one creature or object that you can see within range with a bolt of lightning that crashes over the target, bursting and spraying beyond it in a wave of sound. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d4} lightning damage.

In addition, hit or miss, the blast sprays around the target, creating a 60-foot cone of sound originating from the space just in front of the target. The cone is facing away from you and must include the target in its area. Each creature in the area (including the target) must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} thunder damage, or half as much damage on a success.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Beluud's Bile Blossom}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage dealt (for both parts) increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Freezing Gaze
entries: Your eyes glow with blue light and are charged with seven rays of freezing energy. You can use a bonus action to send one of the rays streaking toward one creature or object within 120 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} cold damage. Whether you hit or miss, the ray is expended. The spell ends early if you expend the last ray.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Crown of Stars}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of motes created increases by two for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Greater Scorching Ray
entries: Seven star-like motes of scorching flame appear and orbit your head until the spell ends. You can use a bonus action to send one of the motes streaking toward one creature or object within 120 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} fire damage. Whether you hit or miss, the mote is expended. The spell ends early if you expend the last mote.

If you have four or more motes remaining, they shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. If you have one to three motes remaining, they shed dim light in a 30-foot radius.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Crown of Stars}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of motes created increases by two for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Shards of Stone
entries: Seven shards of stone appear and orbit your head until the spell ends. You can use a bonus action to send one of the shards streaking toward one creature or object within 120 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} bludgeoning damage. Whether you hit or miss, the shard is expended. The spell ends early if you expend the last shard.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Crown of Stars}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of motes created increases by two for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Crystal Shard Bomb

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A string of crystal shards flashes from your pointing finger, then condenses to linger at a chosen point within range as a bead of jagged shards for the duration. When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the bead blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of crystals. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes piercing damage equal to the total accumulated damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The spell's base damage is {@damage 12d6}. If at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

If the bead is touched before the interval has expired, the creature touching it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the spell ends immediately, causing the bead to erupt. On a successful save, the creature can throw the bead up to 40 feet. When it strikes a creature or a solid object, the spell ends, and the bead explodes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the base damage increases by {@scaledamage 12d6|7-9|1d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Star Flash

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A beam of light flashes from your pointing finger, then condenses to linger at a chosen point within range as a glowing bead for the duration. When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the bead blossoms with a low roar into a flash of intense light. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to the total accumulated damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The spell's base damage is {@damage 12d6}. If at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

If the glowing bead is touched before the interval has expired, the creature touching it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the spell ends immediately, causing the bead to erupt in light. On a successful save, the creature can throw the bead up to 40 feet. When it strikes a creature or a solid object, the spell ends, and the bead explodes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the base damage increases by {@scaledamage 12d6|7-9|1d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Unstable Reaction

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A beam of green light flashes from your pointing finger, then condenses to linger at a chosen point within range as a glowing green bead for the duration. When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the bead blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of acid. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes acid damage equal to the total accumulated damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The spell's base damage is {@damage 12d6}. If at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

If the glowing bead is touched before the interval has expired, the creature touching it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the spell ends immediately, causing the bead to erupt in acid. On a successful save, the creature can throw the bead up to 40 feet. When it strikes a creature or a solid object, the spell ends, and the bead explodes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the base damage increases by {@scaledamage 12d6|7-9|1d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Howling Rift
entries: You clap your hands together, sending out a wave of sound that blast outward in a wall emanating out from you in a direction you choose. The wall lasts until the spell ends. It is 5 feet wide, 30 feet tall and up to 90 feet long, but you can choose a shorter length. The wall's space is difficult terrain. Any ranged weapon attacks that pass in or out of the wall's area have disadvantage.

Each creature within 5 feet of the wall when it appears must make a Strength saving throw. A creature must also make this saving throw when it starts its turn in the wall or enters the wall for the first time on a turn. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 8d10} thunder damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the wall and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
If any ground in the area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-square portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Explosive Rift}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the fire damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Acid Storm
entries: A storm made up of sheets of green acid appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d10} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fire Storm}}

spell.name: Electric Storm
entries: A storm made up of sheets of sea-green lightning appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fire Storm}}

spell.name: Frost Storm
entries: A storm made up of swirls of icy mist appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d10} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fire Storm}}

spell.name: Toxic Pollen Storm
entries: A storm made up of poisonous clouds of pollen appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The spell's area is heavily obscured until the start of your next turn.
If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fire Storm}}

spell.name: Hyperdense Orb

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a sphere made of incredibly dense stone that turns to dust at the end of the duration.

When the sphere appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sphere. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Mordenkainen's Sword}}

spell.name: Jaws of Bile

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a pair of gnashing jaws made of acid.

When the jaws appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} acid damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the jaws up to 20 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Mordenkainen's Sword}}

spell.name: Lance of Light

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a sword made out of arcane light.

When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} radiant damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.
The sword sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Mordenkainen's Sword}}

spell.name: Lightning Ripper

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a sword made of crackling lightning.

When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} lightning damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Mordenkainen's Sword}}

spell.name: Living Flame

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a melon-sized ball of fire with a devilish face and sharp fangs made of flames.

When the ball appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the ball. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} fire damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the ball up to 20 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Mordenkainen's Sword}}

spell.name: Lightspeed Haste
entries: You touch a willing creature and invest it with the magical speed of light. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is tripled, it gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains two additional actions on each of its turns. These actions can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

For the duration, the target also has resistance to radiant damage, has advantage on weapon attack rolls, and deals {@dice 1d6} bonus radiant damage when it hits with a weapon attack. In addition, it can use a bonus action on its turn to teleport in a flash of light up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

When the spell ends, the target falls {@condition prone} and is both {@condition stunned} and {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy and electricity, and pain sweeps over it.
A creature affected by this spell gains no benefit from the haste spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm God's Haste}}

spell.name: White Flame Haste
entries: You touch a willing creature and invest it with the essence of rapid flash fire. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is tripled, it gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains two additional actions on each of its turns. These actions can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

For the duration, the target also has resistance to fire damage, has advantage on weapon attack rolls, and deals {@dice 1d6} bonus fire damage when it hits with a weapon attack. In addition, it can use a bonus action on its turn to teleport in a flash of fire up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

When the spell ends, the target falls {@condition prone} and is both {@condition stunned} and {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy and electricity, and pain sweeps over it.
A creature affected by this spell gains no benefit from the haste spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm God's Haste}}

spell.name: Freezing Icicle
entries: You form a spear of ice, which you use to either make one melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet of you or one ranged spell attack against a target that you can see within range. Then the spear dissolves.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d8 + 20} cold damage, and if it isn't immune to the damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it falls {@condition prone} and becomes {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition stunned} for the duration. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a miss, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects from the spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm Spear}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Elemental Comet
entries: You beckon an elemental comet to descend from above and strike the ground in a freezing explosion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within a 30-foot sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} cold damage and {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

After impact, the freezing comet lurches out of its crater, awakens, and separates into an ice elemental and a fog elemental each of which disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. Each of the elementals takes bludgeoning damage equal to half its maximum hit points from the impact. Creatures in the ice elemental's space are pushed away from the center of the impact point until they are completely outside the elemental's space.

The elementals are friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elementals, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you} If you don't issue any commands to the elementals, they defend themselves from hostile creatures but otherwise take no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the elementals don't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elementals, they become hostile toward you and your companions, and they might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

The DM has the elementals' statistics. This spell deals double damage to objects and structures in the area of the meteor impact. Additionally, ground within the area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5- foot-diameter portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Elemental Meteor}}

spell.name: Astral Flare
entries: You launch a beam of starlight at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} radiant damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} force damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level the radiant and force damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Fulmination
entries: You launch a bolt of roaring, thunderous lightning at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} lightning damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} thunder damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
It repeats the Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Geode Gauntlet
entries: You conjure a huge spiked fist made from solid rock and crystal and throw it at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} nonmagical piercing damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} bludgeoning damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell. This spell always deal maximum damage to objects and structures.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Lancing Icicle
entries: You launch a jagged icicle at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} cold damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} piercing damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Reverberating Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to rumble and vibrate with loud bass when it is drawn. For the duration, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus thunder damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the attack's target is a creature, it is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. It makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Scintillating Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with prismatic flashes of light when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus radiant damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the target is a creature, it must  succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Voltaic Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with bright crackling lightning when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus lightning damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the attack's target is a creature, it has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain concentration resulting from the attack's damage and it can't take reactions or bonus actions until the end of its next turn.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Fetid Swamp Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of gaseous green acid that smells foul and diseased appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Frigid Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of icy white mist appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Thunderhead
entries: A swirling storm cloud with lightning rumbling within appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Scouring Sands
entries: A swirling cloud of abrasive sand that erodes those within appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} piercing damage and {@damage 5d8} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Solar Wind
entries: A swirling cloud of smoke filled with pulses of golden eldritch starlight appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
The cloud sheds dim light in a 40-foot radius.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Dissolving Spray

components.m: fire and a piece of sunstone

entries: A massive foamy wave of transparent acid appears in a 60-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that wave must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d6} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded} by this spell. Constructs and elementals have disadvantage on this saving throw.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded}.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sunburst}}

spell.name: Lava Shield

components.m: a bit of solvent or a swamp frog

entries: You are surrounded by a swirling shield of protective boiling lava that doesn't damage you or your equipment. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You have resistance to cold damage.
• You can't be {@condition restrained} by nonmagical objects.
• Any creature that grapples you or begins its turn while grappling you takes {@damage 12d4} fire damage.
• Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack against you, the creature has disadvantage on the attack, and it takes {@damage 8d4} fire damage before the attack hits or misses.

• When you are attacked with a weapon, the attack misses and the swirling lava consumes the weapon, incinerating it and destroying it. If ammunition was used, it is consumed instead. This doesn't happen if the weapon is magical or a natural weapon, or if the attack used magical ammunition.
A creature killed by this spell is incinerated.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Acid Ward|TEB}}

spell.name: Devouring Slime

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800 gp

entries: There is one possible use for the spell granting immediate effects.

You cast this spell using 1 action, the ground within 60 feet of a point that you choose within range is transformed into incredibly caustic and sticky acidic slime that extends 5 feet deep until the spell ends. The slime sheds bright light for 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet beyond that. A creature walking on the slime must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. Each creature that touches the slime for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw, unless it is already {@condition restrained} by the slime. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 8d6} acid damage and is {@condition restrained} by the slime. On a success, it takes half damage and it isn't {@condition restrained}.

Each creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the lava or enters that area for the first time on a turn takes {@damage 4d6} acid damage, or {@damage 12d6} acid damage if it is {@condition restrained} by the slime. When a {@condition restrained} creature ends its turn, it sinks into the slime. In addition, whenever a creature falls {@condition prone} within the slime or ends its turn while {@condition prone} within the slime, it takes {@dice 8d6} additional acid damage and sinks into the slime. This spell treats creatures that cannot be {@condition prone} as if they are always {@condition prone} instead.

A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to attempt to escape. It makes a Strength check against your spell save DC, with disadvantage if it has sunk into the lava. On a success, it frees itself and stands atop the slime.

The slime damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried, and it flows downhill and through holes or channels (at the DM's discretion) When the spell ends, the slime cools and hardens into black obsidian glass. The obsidian is broken wherever a creature would be trapped inside.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Caldera}}

spell.name: Storm Seizure
entries: You electrify the liquid inside one creature that you can see within range. The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the spell ends, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 7d10 + 30} lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. Water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage and are never immune to this paralysis. The target makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
This spell has no effect on creatures that are immune to cold damage, constructs, or plants. A creature killed by this spell is turned to ashes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Deep Freeze}}

spell.name: Titanic Flaming Sphere
entries: You evoke a massive orb of golden fire with a diameter of 20 feet at a point that you can see within range. It crashes into the ground then rolls up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space.

Each creature in the orb's space when it appears or in its path when it rolls must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 10d12} fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. For the duration, you can use an action on your turn if you are within range of the orb to push it with magic, causing it to roll up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space again.

The orb deals double damage to objects, but it can't roll through an object unless it deals enough damage to destroy the object. If the orb finishes its movement on an incline, it may roll downhill at the end of that turn (at the DM's discretion) rolling each turn until you use an action to roll it again or it reaches level ground.
The orb ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried as well as those that touch it.
The orb sheds bright light in a 100-foot radius and dim light for an additional 100 feet.
When the spell ends, the orb vanishes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Megalith}}

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: A cascade of sand, boulders, gravel and jagged shards plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} piercing damage and {@damage 20d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Rizzak's Firestorm
entries: Orbs made of pure flame, but sparking with golden lightning plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} fire damage and {@damage 20d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Storm God's Decree
entries: A primordial storm of powerful lightning bolt and thundering sound plummets to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} lightning damage and {@damage 20d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Voracity
entries: Clouds of monstrous, aberrant teeth that splash with eldritch digestive acid plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} acid damage and {@damage 20d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one cloud is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Vorpal Icicles
entries: Massive jagged spikes of ice plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range.
